description: Construction of a two-storey attached building to rear/side of existing property to accommodate 3 additional self-contained residential units with access from Locarno Road; refurbishment of existing building containing 5 residential units; alterations to front, rear and side elevations including new windows, bay windows, fascias, rendering; alterations to existing roof; and provision of associated communal amenity space, cycle store and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: SKA GF 08 00 02 Rev A01 (Site Plan as Proposed); SKA GF 08 70 01 Rev A01 (Elevations as Proposed); and SKA GF 08 90 01 Rev A01 (Floor Plans as Proposed).
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.

| The materials to be used in the construction of the development hereby approved shall be in full accordance with the details specified in the approved drawings listed in Condition 2 and Page 16 of the Design and Access Statement by SK Architecture. No variations shall be made unless otherwise agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of the Ealing Local Plan (Reg 19) (2024).

| Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 or any Order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification, no extension, enlargement, or other alteration of the hereby approved development other than that expressly authorised by this permission shall be carried out without planning permission first obtained from the local planning authority.

Reason: The local planning authority considers that further development could cause detriment to the amenities of the occupiers of nearby properties and the character of the area and, for this reason, would wish to control any future development with regard to policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan 2013, policy 1.1 (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policy D6 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

| Notwithstanding the approved drawings, refuse/recycling storage shall be provided in accordance with Council policies and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) Policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policies D3 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021).
| Notwithstanding the submitted plans, 9 secure and covered cycling spaces shall be provided on site prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development and retained thereafter.

Reason: To encourage the use of sustainable transport, provide for adequate cycle parking facilities and to safeguard the appearance of the property and the amenities of the area, in accordance with Policies D4, T1, T2, T4 and T5 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to commencement of the development (excluding site clearance, demolition and ground works), a noise assessment report shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of external noise sources including transport/ industrial/ commercial/ cultural uses and their noise levels occurring at the site during most of the year, ie. measured during school and work weekdays. Details shall include the sound insulation of the building envelope including glazing specifications (laboratory tested including frames, seals, and any integral ventilators, approved in accordance with BS EN ISO 10140-2:2010) and of acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and details of self-noise). Details of internal noise levels according to BS8233:2014 shall be provided, together with best practicable mitigation measures, as necessary, to achieve the criteria for external amenity spaces. The approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

| Prior to commencement of the development (excluding site clearance, demolition and ground works), details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation values of at least 5dB above the ADE Building Regulations values, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedroom adjoining dining/ living room of separate dwelling, and of at least 10dB enhancement for bedroom adjoining a separate stairwell. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with Policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), Policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2024).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the Biodiversity Net Gain Assessment Report (ref. SKA GF 05 90 01) to achieve 123.1% biodiversity net gain. The landowner is legally responsible for creating and enhancing the habitats identified in the Biodiversity Net Gain Assessment Report (ref. SKA GF 05 90 01), and managing these habitats for at least 30 years from when you complete creating or enhancing the habitat to satisfy this condition.

The Local Planning Authority has several powers to efficiently monitor biodiversity net gain, including Planning Contravention Notices (PCN), which are a requisition for information from landowners or operators. Non-compliance with a Planning Contravention Notice or providing misinformation can result in prosecution and fines.
If the habitat enhancement does not go as planned and the 123.1% biodiversity net gain cannot be achieved, you must notify the planning authority immediately.

Reason: To ensure that the biodiversity gain objective is met, in accordance with Schedule 7A of the Town and Country Planning Act (1990), Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021) and Planning practice guidance on biodiversity net gain Biodiversity net gain - GOV.UK (www.gov.uk).
| The landscaping as identified in the approved drawings listed in condition 2 shall be completed prior to occupation of thereby approved development and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To ensure appropriate landscaping and amenity, in accordance with Policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 3.5, 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of the Ealing Local Plan (Reg 19) (2024).
